gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 1,57]]When the time arrived for Elizabeth to have her child she gave birth to a son.
[[Lc 1,58]]Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown his great mercy toward her, and they rejoiced with her.
[[Lc 1,59]]When they came on the eighth day to circumcise the child, they were going to call him Zechariah after his father,
[[Lc 1,60]]but his mother said in reply, "No. He will be called John."
[[Lc 1,61]]But they answered her, "There is no one among your relatives who has this name."
[[Lc 1,62]]So they made signs, asking his father what he wished him to be called.
[[Lc 1,63]]He asked for a tablet and wrote, "John is his name," and all were amazed.
[[Lc 1,64]]Immediately his mouth was opened, his tongue freed, and he spoke blessing God.
[[Lc 1,65]]Then fear came upon all their neighbors, and all these matters were discussed throughout the hill country of Judea.
[[Lc 1,66]]All who heard these things took them to heart, saying, "What, then, will this child be?" For surely the hand of the Lord was with him.
[[Lc 1,80]]The child grew and became strong in spirit, and he was in the desert until the day of his manifestation to Israel.

second_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles
second_reading.text:
[[Ac 13,22]]In those days, Paul said: â€œGod raised up David as king; of him God testified, I have found David, son of Jesse, a man after my own heart; he will carry out my every wish.
[[Ac 13,23]]From this man's descendants God, according to his promise, has brought to Israel a savior, Jesus.
[[Ac 13,24]]John heralded his coming by proclaiming a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel;
[[Ac 13,25]]and as John was completing his course, he would say, 'What do you suppose that I am? I am not he. Behold, one is coming after me; I am not worthy to unfasten the sandals of his feet.'"

psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah
first_reading.text:
[[Is 49,1]]Hear me, O islands, listen, O distant peoples. The Lord called me from birth, from my mother's womb he gave me my name.
[[Is 49,2]]He made of me a sharp-edged sword and concealed me in the shadow of his arm. He made me a polished arrow, in his quiver he hid me.
[[Is 49,3]]You are my servant, he said to me, Israel, through whom I show my glory.
[[Is 49,4]]Though I thought I had toiled in vain, and for nothing, uselessly, spent my strength, Yet my reward is with the LORD, my recompense is with my God.
[[Is 49,5]]For now the LORD has spoken who formed me as his servant from the womb, That Jacob may be brought back to him and Israel gathered to him; And I am made glorious in the sight of the LORD, and my God is now my strength!
[[Is 49,6]]It is too little, he says, for you to be my servant, to raise up the tribes of Jacob, and restore the survivors of Israel; I will make you a light to the nations, that my salvation may reach to the ends of the earth.
